FacilityName: City of Dublin Water Pollution Control Plant

_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: alarm system, use of 2-man teams, safety program/procedures, vacuum system
_prev_prog_2.Description:
CHAPTER - 3 PREVENTION PROGRAM

3.1 Safety Information 
3.1.1The following information is maintained on each site where   chlorine is handled 
a. Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for chlorine.
B. Chlorine specific standard operating (handling) procedures.
3.1.2 The following parameters have been established to ensure the safe operation of chlorination equipment at the Water Pollution Control facilities.
     A. The maximum intended inventory of chlorine is 8000 lbs stored in one ton containers at the water pollution control plant.
B.  Operating temperature is always    
     atmospheric except during winter weather  when 
     freeze protection heating is used.  Control of the chlorination         process at the water pollution control plant is by manual operator control.  Chlorine residual analyzers have been included in the upgrade  for the water pollution control  plant.
C.The chlorine detector and alarm at the water pollution control plant is set at a detection limit of 0.7 ppm.  
d. The chlorination process is designed in compliance with recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices.  Facilities were designed and built  in conformance with the following Codes and Standards:
(1)Equipment Code/Standard
(2) Electrical  National Electrical Code(NEC)
(3) Piping  American Society of    
Mechanical Engineers/American National Standards Institute (ASME/ANSI)
(4) Storage Tank ASME Boiler and Pressure 
Vessel Code, Section VIII,  Div 1
(5) Structures  Uniform Building Code 
(UBC), American Society for  
Testing Materials (ASTM)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The City of Dublin's Risk Management Plan for Safe Chlorination Handling involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices to monitor potential chlorine hazards and minimize the risk of accidental chlorine releases.  All applicable procedures of 40 CFR 68.170 are addressed in the plan, which seeks to provide for employee safety, public health and response agency interaction.



The City of Dublin's Water Pollution Control Plant uses chlorine to disinfect the effluent wastewater before it is discharged into the Oconee River  and the effluent reuse to SPNewsPrint.  



The City of Dublin's Utilities Management Program includes the following key elements to mitigate the effects of potential chlorine release hazards.

*   Operator Training

*   Prevention Maintenance Program 

*   Process Specific Safety Equipment

*   Safe and effective standard operating procedures, written with operator 

participation

*   Hazard review of equipment and procedures 

*    Auditing and inspection programs.

*   Comprehensive Management Program



Furthermore, the Surface Water Plant and the Water Pollution Control Plant have an active environmental, health and safety program with the following elements specifically supporting the safe handling of chlorine and the chlorination process.

*   Chlorine detectors

*   Chemical Right to Know Program

*   Personal Protective Equipment



In case of accidental release, the Laurens Emergency Planning Agency has an emergency response plan for the Water Pollution Control Plant.



The City of Dublin Utilities Department takes a proactive approach to risk management and emergency response.  Preventative measures will provide for the continuous improvement of communications and will maintain effective procedures for the safe handling of and timely emergency response to potential chlorine hazards.
